title: Missing daughter of Worcester mother in ICE detention found, police say
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: 13-year-old daughter of detained Worcester mother Rosane Ferreira De Oliveira found safe in Massachusetts, now in DCF custody.
17-year-old Nayara Ferreira De Moura, also missing since July, remains unaccounted for, last seen in early June.
Rosane Ferreira De Oliveira detained in New Hampshire by ICE, arrest involved neighbor protests and Councilor Etel Haxhiaj.

title: Here’s what to know about the HHS demand that Mass. erase ‘gender ideology’ from sex ed materials
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: HHS demands Massachusetts remove 'gender ideology' from sex ed to retain up to $2.36 million in federal funding.
The Trump administration views references to gender identity in sex education as outside PREP's authorizing statute.
Massachusetts among 46 states urged to align federally funded sex ed with traditional gender definitions or risk funding loss.

title: Filipa Patão shared her thoughts on becoming the inaugural head coach of Boston Legacy FC
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Filipa Patão, former Benfica manager, was appointed as the inaugural head coach of Boston Legacy FC in June 2025.
Patão, 36, led Benfica to multiple titles and aims to build a legacy with Boston Legacy FC in the NWSL.
Patão and general manager Domènec Guasch, formerly of Barcelona, share a similar soccer philosophy for team strategy.

title: Jeremy Swayman feels like a ‘completely different human being’ a year removed from contract dispute
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman enters the 2025-26 season without contract issues, signing an eight-year, $66 million deal last October.
Swayman's 2024-25 season saw struggles with the Bruins after missing training camp, leading to a career-low .892 save percentage.
Swayman aims to bounce back, utilizing a summer focused on training and improved performance, including a strong showing at the IIHF Worlds.

title: What Josh McDaniels said about facing the Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Josh McDaniels will face his former team, the Raiders, as Patriots offensive coordinator in Sunday's home opener.
McDaniels reflects on his 9-16 record with the Raiders and plans to learn from past experiences in Las Vegas.
The Patriots' opener will feature new players like Drake Maye and Stefon Diggs at Gillette Stadium on Sunday.

title: Elizabeth Banks cast as Karen Read: What readers said about the limited series role
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Elizabeth Banks will star and executive produce a limited series on Karen Read's case for Prime Video.
Banks' casting received mixed reactions; 48% of 250 readers agreed she's the right choice for the role.
The series explores true crime and conspiracy themes; based on the podcast 'Karen,' but Read opposes it.

title: 2 New England casinos just ranked the best in the U.S. (that aren’t in Las Vegas)
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Mohegan Sun in Uncasville, Conn., ranked No. 2 in USA Today's list of top non-Vegas casinos.
Foxwoods Resort Casino in Mashantucket, Conn., ranked No. 3 in the same USA Today list.
USA Today's list highlights casinos with expansive gaming options and exceptional guest experiences.

title: What to know about Seisiún, the two-day Irish music festival coming to Boston
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Seisiún, a two-day Irish music festival, will be held at Suffolk Downs in Boston, featuring Dropkick Murphys and The Pogues.
The Pogues, appearing in the U.S. for the first time in over 20 years, will headline the festival's second day.
Single-day and two-day tickets for Seisiún are available through AXS, with prices ranging from $75 to $403.

title: CommonWealth Kitchen staff, members speak out over toxic nonprofit: Globe report
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: CommonWealth Kitchen staff and members accuse leadership of creating a toxic workplace and failing to provide promised support.
Gourmet Kreyol owner claimed CWK overcharged for services, used her story for fundraising, and attempted to poach an employee.
Executive Director Jen Faigel acknowledged challenges post-pandemic; CWK held town halls and reformed its board amid high staff turnover.

title: 44 proposed Mass. ballot questions, including rent control, move to next step — and 3 don’t make the cut
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: 44 Massachusetts proposed ballot questions, including rent control, advance to the next step; three proposals were rejected.
By Dec. 3, teams must collect 74,574 registered voter signatures to potentially reach ballots; Legislature reviews until May.
For constitutional amendments, 25% of two joint legislative sessions needed for November 2028 ballot approval.
